title: Drosophila Evolution in a Lab Set Member 4

content.description: Starch is a complex carbohydrate that is digested by the enzyme amylase. A mutation in the gene that encodes amylase prevents the digestion of starch. The inability to digest starch is an autosomal recessive trait. In a population of <math alttext="1,000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> flies, <math alttext="410" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>410</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> were unable to break down starch.
content.question: Which of the following is closest to the number of flies expected to be heterozygous for the amylase mutation assuming all conditions of Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium are met?
